document.docAuthor: Song, Zi-Wei, Xue, Xiao-Feng & Hong, Xiao-Yue
document.masterDocTitle: Six new species of Aculus Keifer from Tibet Autonomous Region, China (Acari: Eriophyoidea: Eriophyidae: Phyllocoptinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Six new species of Aculus Keifer from Tibet Autonomous Region, China (Acari: Eriophyoidea: Eriophyidae: Phyllocoptinae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to
Aculus
species in China

paragraph.keyLead:
4 Setae
h 1
absent, tarsal empodium 5 -rayed
........................................................ Aculus ablopurpurascus
Huang, 2001 a

7 Prodorsal shield sub-pentagonal, median, admedian and submedian lines complete, median and admedian lines con- nected near base; female genital coverflap with 8 longitudinal ridges and 3 transverse lines in two ranks at base.......
.............................................................................................................. Aculus toxicodendri
Xue, Song & Hong, 2008

- Prodorsal shield design with incomplete median line and complete admedian lines, submedian line absent, admedian lines connected at posterior; female genital coverflap with 10-12 longitudinal ridges.
Aculus cayratiae
Kuang, 1987

8 Prodorsal shield with granules on anterior margin
.......................................... Aculus asteri
Xue, Song & Hong, 2008

9 Prodorsal shield subtriangular, design with median line incomplete, admedian and submedian lines complete; frontal lobe without spine ..................................................................................
Aculus ligustri (
Keifer, 1938
)
in Kuang, 1995

- Prodorsal shield design with median line absent, incomplete admedian and submedian lines; frontal lobe with two spines
............................................................................................................... Aculus mansoni
Amrine & Stasny, 1994
- Setae f on 6 th ventral annulus from rear; tarsal solenidion tapered; coxal plates I not separated. ............................. 11

11 Ventral annuli with round microtubercles; tarsal empodium 5 -rayed; female genital coverflap with 7-8 longitudinal ridges, 4 discontinuous lines at base; frontal lobe with two spines.
........... Aculus sargentodoxae
Wei & Kuang, 1997

- Ventral annuli with tapered microtubercles; tarsal empodium 6 -rayed; female genital coverflap with 2 ranks ridges; frontal lobe without spine ...............................................................................
Aculus longanensis
Wei & Kuang, 1997

13 Female
genital coverflap smooth
.............................................. Aculus gladitsiae
Kuang & Luo in
Kuang et al ., 2005

14 Female
genital coverflap with 2 transverse lines at base..............................
Aculus cuihuae Xue, Song & Hong, 2008

18 Prodorsal shield with granules at lateral, frontal lobe without spine; paraxial tibial seta ( l' ) located 1 / 4 from dorsal base; setae f on 6 th ventral annulus from rear
............................................... Aculus rumexis
Xue, Song & Hong, 2008

- Prodorsal shield without granules, frontal lobe with two spines; paraxial tibial seta ( l' ) located 1 / 3 from dorsal base; setae f on 5 th ventral annulus from rear
.................................................................. Aculus melia
Kuang & Zhuo, 1989

19 Prodorsal shield design with median line absent; setae f on 4 th ventral annulus from rear ...........................................
................................................................................................. Aculus guilinensis
Kuang & Luo in
Kuang et al ., 2005
- Prodorsal shield design with median line present; setae f on 5 th ventral annulus from rear...................................... 20

20 Prodorsal shield design with median and admedian lines incomplete, submedian line absent; frontal lobe with two spines; tarsal empodium 4 -rayed, tarsal solenidion rod-like
......................................... Aculus pistaciae
Kuang, 1998 a

- Prodorsal shield design with all lines complete; frontal lobe without spine; tarsal empodium 5 -rayed, tarsal solenid- ion tapered
.............................................................................................. Aculus broussonetiae
Lin, Jin & Kuang, 1997

22 Prodorsal shield with only thick admedian lines, a transverse line connected with admedian lines forming H shape, granules on center and lateral
................................................................................................. Aculus sorbariae
sp. nov.

- Prodorsal shield with all lines complete, median and admedian lines connected with a transverse line at 1 / 4 from posterior
................................................................................................................. Aculus persicae
Xue & Hong, 2005

25 Dorsal annuli with spiny microtubercles; tarsal empodium 7 -rayed.
........................ Aculus daibuensis
Huang, 2001 b
- Dorsal annuli with elliptical or elongated microtubercles; tarsal empodium 4 to 6 -rayed......................................... 26

26 Tarsal empodium 6 -rayed; female genital coverflap with 12 longitudinal ridges and 2 transverse lines at base...........
..................................................................................................................... Aculus amurens
Xue, Song & Hong, 2008
- Tarsal empodium 4 or 5 -rayed; female genital coverflap without transverse line at base.......................................... 27
- Coxal plates with short lines; tarsal empodium 4 -rayed, tarsal solenidion knobbed.................................................. 28

28 Coxal plates with only short lines; setae f on 5 th ventral annulus from rear; female genital coverflap with 8 longitu- dinal ridges and granules at base; dorsal annuli with elliptical microtubercles all over the dorsal opisthosoma...........
..................................................................................................................... Aculus jingbois
Xue, Song & Hong, 2008

- Coxal plates with short lines and granules; setae f on 6 th ventral annulus from rear; female genital coverflap with 1214 longitudinal ridges; dorsal annuli with elliptical microtubercles except 7 to 8 annuli from rear smooth ...........
......................................................................................................................................... Aculus tibetsalicinus
sp. nov.

31 Tarsal empodium 5 -rayed; dorsal annuli with filament microtubercles; female genital coverflap with 10 longitudinal ridges and 3 transverse lines at base
.......................................................... Aculus eupteleae
Xue, Song & Hong, 2008

- Tarsal empodium 4 -rayed; dorsal annuli with elongated or tapered microtubercles; female genital coverflap without transverse line at base ................................................................................................................................................. 32
- Dorsal annuli with elongated microtubercles; setae f on 5 th ventral annulus from rear ............................................ 33

33 Prodorsal shield design with all lines present and complete; coxal plates with granules only, paraxial tibial seta ( l' ) located 1 / 4 from dorsal base
........................................................... Aculus tetanothrix
(
Nalepa, 1889
) in Kuang, 1995

- Prodorsal shield design with median and submedian lines incomplete; coxal plates with short lines; paraxial tibial seta ( l' ) located 1 / 3 from dorsal base. ......................................................................................................................... 34

34 Coxal plates with short lines only; prodorsal shield design with all lines incomplete and thick, submedian lines con- nected with a transverse line at 1 / 3 from anterior forming n shape
....................................... Aculus jasmini
sp. nov.

- Coxal plates with short lines and granules; prodorsal shield design with median and submedian lines incomplete, admedian lines complete, laterally sparsely granulate
.............. Aculus schlechtendali
(
Nalepa, 1890
) in Kuang, 1995

35 Dorsal annuli with microtubercles laterally, others smooth ...................................
Aculus shanghaiensis Kuang, 1997

- Coxal plates with both short lines and granules
........................................................... Aculus lhasasorbariae
sp. nov.

38 Dorsal annuli with spiny microtubercles
........................................................... Aculus coggygriae
Xue & Hong, 2005

39 Tarsal empodium 7 -rayed; dorsal annuli with filament microtubercles ...................................
Aculus vignaus
sp. nov.
- Tarsal empodium 4 or 6 -rayed; dorsal annuli with elliptical microtubercles ............................................................. 40
- Ventral annuli with spiny or round microtubercles; setae f on 6 th ventral annulus from rear.................................... 41

41 Tarsal empodium 6 -rayed, tarsal solenidion tapered; female genital coverflap with 8 longitudinal ridges ...................
.................................................................................................................. Aculus changbais
Xue, Song & Hong, 2008
- Tarsal empodium 4 -rayed, tarsal solenidion rod-like; female genital coverflap with 10 to 12 longitudinal ridges ... 42

42 Prodorsal shield design with median line complete, frontal lobe with four spines; ventral annuli with round microtu- bercles
...................................................................................................................... Aculus salicis
Kuang & Luo, 1997

- Prodorsal shield design with median lines 1 / 3 at base, frontal lobe without spine; ventral annuli with spiny microtu- bercles
................................................................................................................. Aculus altissimae
Xue & Hong, 2005

keyLead.keyStep:
43 Paraxial tibial seta ( l' ) located 1 / 4 from dorsal base, tarsal solenidion tapered; dorsal annuli with round microtuber- cles; setae f on 6 th ventral annulus from rear
...................................................... Aculus huixiansis
Xue & Hong, 2005

paragraph.keyLead: - Paraxial tibial seta ( l' ) located 1 / 3 from dorsal base, tarsal solenidion knobbed; dorsal annuli with elliptical microtu-

subSubSection.paragraph:
bercles; setae f on 5 th ventral annulus from rear ........................................................................................................ 44
44 Prodorsal shield design with incomplete median line connected with admedian lines by two diagonal lines at 1 / 4 from rear, admedian and submedian lines connected with together by a arc line at about 1 / 4 from anterior ................
.............................................................................................................................. Aculus amygdali
Xue & Hong, 2005

paragraph.keyLead:
- Prodorsal shield design with median line 2 / 3 of the shield, median and admedian lines separated, admedian and submedian lines also separated and subparallel ....................................................
Aculus parafockeui
Liu & Kuang, 1998
